Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Apologetic \A*pol`o*get"ic\, Apologetical \A*pol`o*get"ic*al\, a. [Gr. ?, fr. ? to speak in defense of; ? from + ? speech, ? to say, to speak. See {Logic}.] Defending by words or arguments; said or written in defense, or by way of apology; regretfully excusing; as, an apologetic essay. ``To speak in a subdued and apologetic tone.'' --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
apologetic adj : offering or expressing apology; "an apologetic note"; "an apologetic manner" [syn: {excusatory}] [ant: {unapologetic}]
